Protect Your Ndax Account with Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) is a critical security feature that adds an extra layer of protection to your Ndax account. It helps ensure that only you can access your account—even if someone else gets hold of your password.

With 2FA enabled, logging into your Ndax account requires two steps:

  1. Your login credentials – username and password.
  2. A unique 6-digit code – generated by an authenticator app on your mobile device (e.g., Google Authenticator or Authy). This code refreshes every 30 seconds.

This means that even if your password is compromised, unauthorized users will not be able to access your account without the time-sensitive verification code.

2FA is one of the most effective ways to help prevent unauthorized access and secure your crypto assets on Ndax.
